metadata.title: CVE-2022-4382 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
A use-after-free flaw caused by a race among the superblock operations inthe gadgetfs Linux driver was found. It could be triggered by yanking out adevice that is running the gadgetfs side.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-4382` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-146-generic - 5.4.0-146.163~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-146-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-146.163~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-16.19').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-146.163~18.04.1').
